summary: Completed comprehensive testing of LinkedIn Insights Microservice. Backend API structure is working correctly (health check, pagination, filtering), but core scraping functionality is broken due to Playwright browser installation issues. Frontend navigation and error handling are working properly.

critical_bugs.issue: Playwright browser executable not found - scraping functionality completely broken
critical_bugs.impact: Core functionality unavailable - cannot scrape any LinkedIn pages
critical_bugs.suggested_fix: Run 'playwright install' in backend directory or fix containerized browser installation

working_endpoints.status: Working - returns proper health check response
Working - returns 404 when page not scraped (expected behavior)
Working - returns 404 when page not scraped (expected behavior)
Working - returns 404 when page not scraped (expected behavior)

passed_tests: List pages with filters - name, industry, follower count filters functional
Posts/employees/followers endpoints - proper 404 responses when page not found
Frontend error message display - properly shows backend errors
Frontend page list navigation and filtering
Frontend form inputs and button interactions
Frontend routing between dashboard and page list

success_percentage.backend: 85.7% (6/7 tests passed - scraping blocked by Playwright issue)

action_item_for_main_agent: CRITICAL: Fix Playwright browser installation in containerized environment. The scraping functionality is completely broken due to missing Chromium executable. All other API endpoints and frontend functionality are working correctly. Suggested fixes: 1) Ensure 'playwright install' runs properly in container, 2) Check if additional system dependencies are needed for headless browser in container, 3) Consider alternative scraping approaches if Playwright continues to fail in this environment.
